message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try {
    PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("file.txt"));
    printWriter.print("hello world");
    printWriter.flush();
    printWriter.close();
    System.out.println("file written");
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are not flushing the PrintWriter before closing it. Flushing ensures that any buffered data is written to the underlying file. By calling the flush() method before closing the PrintWriter, you ensure that the changes are saved permanently.
